This is a recurring bug. Fix it for the target release and open a new bug for the next recurrence.
The CLDR data, currently under tool/data/cldr, needs to be updated from http://cldr.unicode.org/ (getting to e.g. http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads). Use the data download of a released version (or, recently, do an SVN checkout of the release tag), and update from common/main. Do this way ahead of an upcoming release, so there is plenty of time to validate the data in applications.

Within the grunt toolchain we use the CLDR data too (see bug #8297). Instead of the XML data representation we use the JSON data representation there. The JSON data is now also part of the SDK and needs an update too. The readme ("tool/grunt/task/package/locale/data/readme.txt") has all the details - basically it's just: download a zip archive, unzip it and commit the data.
Both data pools ("tool/data/cldr" and "tool/grunt/task/package/locale/data/cldr") are currently using version 25.
